subsections.title: Identify Internal Issues
questions: Which organizational structures (departments, management levels, resources) influence quality management?
How is the corporate strategy considered in relation to quality?
Are strengths and weaknesses identified and documented?

subsections.title: Identify External Issues
questions: Which market conditions influence the QMS?
How are legal or regulatory requirements identified and integrated?
Are there technological developments that influence QM?

subsections.title: Interested Parties and Their Requirements
questions: Which internal interested parties influence the QMS?
Which external interested parties are relevant?
What requirements do these stakeholders have?
How are expectations captured and assessed?
Are there feedback processes for stakeholders?

subsections.title: Documentation and Updates
questions: Are all relevant locations, departments and processes included?
Is it clear which products/services fall under the QMS?
Is the scope of the QMS communicated internally and externally?

subsections.title: Management System and Interfaces
questions: Is there a description of how QMS is integrated (organizational chart, process landscape)?
How are corporate objectives linked with quality objectives?
How are overlaps with other management systems handled?
Are processes monitored and controlled using KPIs?

subsections.title: Responsibility and Commitment of Management
questions: How does top management demonstrate commitment to quality?
Is quality communicated as a strategic success factor?

subsections.title: Quality Policy
questions: Is there an accessible quality policy?
Is it linked to the strategic direction?
Does it contain statements on customer orientation, improvement, requirements?

subsections.title: Roles, Responsibilities and Authorities
questions: Can responsible parties decide on actions?
Can responsible parties stop production/processes in case of error risk?

subsections.title: Participation and Consultation of Workers
questions: Are there officers (compliance, data protection, etc.)?
How do they work with the QMS?
Are there feedback and idea mechanisms?

subsections.title: Risks and Opportunities
questions: Are risks/opportunities systematically identified, assessed, documented?
Are there actions for prioritized risks?

subsections.title: Legal and Other Requirements
questions: How is it ensured that changes are identified and implemented?

subsections.title: Quality Objectives
questions: Is there time scheduling and prioritization?

subsections.title: Emergency and Crisis Planning
questions: Are roles and actions regularly practiced?
Are there emergency plans for absences?

subsections.title: Resource Management & Budget
questions: Are there plans for preventive maintenance?
How are intervals and documentation managed?

subsections.title: Documented Information
questions: How are documents created and versioned?
Is there a system for managing confidential data?

subsections.title: Knowledge Management
questions: How is knowledge identified and shared?
Are there measures against knowledge loss?

subsections.title: Communication & Documentation
questions: How is it ensured that updates are communicated promptly?

subsections.title: Operational Planning and Control
questions: Are there process objectives and evaluations?
Are there quality inspections and approvals?

subsections.title: Procurement & Supplier Management
questions: Are suppliers assessed according to criteria?

subsections.title: Emergency Preparedness and Response
questions: Are first aiders available and trained?
Are there follow-up processes for emergencies?

subsections.title: Maintenance Management
questions: How often are maintenance activities performed?

subsections.title: Sustainability & Environmental Protection
questions: Is climate change considered in the assessment?

subsections.title: Internal Audits
questions: How is the audit scope defined?

subsections.title: Lessons Learned
questions: Are there processes for innovation and development?
How are employees motivated to submit ideas?
